metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3471 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.45 and earlier and 5.6.26 and earlier allows local users to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via vectors related to Server: Option.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbd18 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-client - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-common - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-test - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-test-data - 10.0.21-1
No subscription required

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.21-1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
